Question.Text: A 16-year-old girl presents to a clinic in Malawi with fever, headache, abdominal pain, jaundice. She has recently delivered a baby

Answer: Typhoid fever (Enteric fever) - The postpartum patient presents with fever, headache, abdominal pain, and jaundice in Malawi. The images show characteristic rose spots (salmon-colored maculopapular rash) on the trunk and Salmonella typhi bacteria on culture/microscopy. Typhoid can be severe in postpartum women with hepatic involvement causing jaundice.
